Whether you want to visit the French quarter of Pondicherr (Read More)y, the beach capital Goa, the hippie destination Gokarna or the coastal city Mangalore, the beaches near Bangalore are sure to exceed your expectations! Here is the list of 24 Beaches Near Bangalore for a Perfect Beach Escape 1. Om Beach, Gokarna 4.4 /5 Om Beach, situated in the coastal town of Gokarna, is a pristine shoreline renowned for its distinctive "Om" shape created by the meeting of two crescent beaches. It offers a tranquil escape with golden sands and serene waters, making it an ideal spot for relaxation and water sports.Things to do: Surfing, speedboat, boatingHow to Reach from Bangalore: To reach Om Beach from Bangalore, you can take a train to Gokarna Road Railway Station or travel by road. From Gokarna, Om Beach is a short drive or hike away. Distance from Bangalore: 483 km Read More 2. Paradise Beach, Pondicherry 4.4 /5 Paradise Beach in Pondicherry, also known as Plage Paradiso, is a tranquil haven known for its pristine golden sands and crystal-clear waters. Visitors can relax on the beach, swim, and enjoy water sports while experiencing the natural beauty and serenity of this coastal paradise.Things to do: Fishing, water sportsHow to Reach from Bangalore: From Bangalore, you can reach Pondicherry by road. Once in Pondicherry, you can access Paradise Beach by taking a boat from the Chunnambar Boat House, which is around 8 kilometers from the city center. Distance from Bangalore: 320 km Read More 3. Varkala Beach 4.4 /5 View 7+ photos Varkala Beach, situated on the Arabian Sea coast in Kerala, is a stunning destination known for its unique combination of cliffs, golden sands, and the serene sea. It's a popular spot for both relaxation and water activities, offering a rejuvenating experience by the ocean.Things to do: Windsurfing, parasailing, paragliding and snorkellingHow to Reach from Bangalore: You can take a train from Bangalore to Varkala Sivagiri Railway Station, which is well-connected. Alternatively, you can drive to Varkala, which takes approximately 13-14 hours by road. Distance from Bangalore: 680 km Read More 4. Malpe Beach, Udupi 4.1 /5 View 5+ photos Malpe Beach, situated in Udupi, is a pristine coastal haven renowned for its golden sands and clear waters. Visitors can enjoy beachcombing, water sports, and breathtaking sunsets while experiencing the coastal charm of this Karnataka gem.Things to do: Banana rides, speed boat rides, water scooter rides, surfing, speed boat cruisesHow to Reach from Bangalore: To reach Malpe Beach from Bangalore, you can take a train to Udupi Railway Station or drive by road, which takes approximately 8-9 hours. From Udupi, you can reach Malpe Beach by taxi or local transport. Murudeshwar Beach, Karnataka 4.2 /5 Murudeshwar Beach, situated on the coast of Karnataka, is renowned for its pristine shores and the towering Murudeshwar Temple gopuram that overlooks the Arabian Sea. Visitors can enjoy the tranquil beauty of the beach, engage in beach activities, and explore the nearby temple complex.Things to do: Jogging, Parasailing, boatingHow to Reach from Bangalore: The most convenient way to reach Murudeshwar Beach from Bangalore is by road. It can be reached in around 9-10 hours by car or bus.  Distance from Bangalore: 489 km Read More 6. Mahabalipuram Beach, Tamil Nadu 3.7 /5 Mahabalipuram Beach, located on the shores of the Bay of Bengal in Tamil Nadu, is a tranquil stretch of coastline known for its ancient temples and stone sculptures. Visitors can relax by the sea, explore the UNESCO World Heritage Sites nearby, and savor fresh seafood at local eateries.Things to do: Diving, motor boating, sunbathing, windsurfingHow to Reach from Bangalore: To reach Mahabalipuram Beach from Bangalore, you can take a train or a bus to Chennai, and from there, it's a scenic drive of approximately 58 kilometers to Mahabalipuram. Distance from Bangalore: 350 km Read More 7. Karwar Beach Karwar Beach, located along the picturesque Arabian Sea coastline, is a tranquil and scenic escape in Karnataka. With its golden sands and serene ambiance, it's an ideal spot for beach lovers seeking relaxation and water activities.Things to do: Water sports, bird watchingHow to Reach from Bangalore: You can drive or take a bus from Bangalore to Karwar, which takes approximately 9-10 hours. Another option is to take a train to Karwar Railway Station, which is well-connected to Bangalore. Read More 8. Palolem Beach, Goa 4.4 /5 View 9+ photos A white sand paradise on the southern tip of Goa, this stunning beach near Bangalore is approximately 38 km from Madgaon in Canacona and is among the favourite destinations for travellers seeking peace and quiet. No wonder then that it sees endless hordes of foreign as well as domestic travellers that make the quaint thatched roof cottages on the shore, their home.Things to do: Swimming, scuba diving, kayaking, dolphin spottingHow to Reach from Bangalore: The most convenient way to reach Palolem Beach from Bangalore is to take a flight to Goa's Dabolim Airport and then drive or take a taxi to Palolem, which is about a 1.5 to 2-hour journey. Distance from Bangalore: 550 km Read More 9. Bekal, Kerala 4.2 /5 View 8+ photos Known For : Bekal Fort Bekal Beach Kappil Beach Located on the wide expanse of the Malabar coastline, Bekal is famous for its forts, backwaters, and beaches. Located just a couple of hours away from Bangalore, Bekal is an ideal place to hit a beach near Bangalore. The view of the Bekal beach from the top of the Bekal fort is breathtaking. Bekal beach is not a virgin beach, but it is not always crowded like several other commercial beaches in India. Things to do: Relaxing, WalkingHow to Reach from Bangalore: To reach Bekal from Bangalore, you can take a train or bus to Kasaragod, the nearest major town, and then proceed to Bekal. The nearest airport is Mangalore International Airport, which is about 80 kilometers away from Bekal. Distance from Bangalore: 376 km Best Time: October to March 12 Bekal Attractions View Packages Read More 10. Kudle Beach, Gokarna 4.3 /5 Kudle Beach is one of the many beaches near Bangalore, situated very close to Gokarna Beach or Om Beach. The beach is a paradise for those who love peace and quiet while they travel. A complete recluse, this beach offers the most silent and serene atmosphere to enjoy a sunset, a walk along the shore or simply sit and observe the never-ceasing tides. Things to do: Relaxing, walking, trekkingHow to Reach from Bangalore: You can drive or take a bus to Gokarna, which is well-connected to Bangalore via NH66. The journey by road typically takes around 8-9 hours. From Gokarna town, Kudle Beach is easily accessible by auto-rickshaw or a short hike. Distance from Bangalore: 487 km Read More 11. Marina Beach, Chennai 4.3 /5 View 47+ photos Marina Beach in Chennai, one of the longest urban beaches in the world, stretches along the Bay of Bengal, offering a picturesque shoreline perfect for leisurely strolls and scenic sunsets. Visitors can enjoy the sea breeze and explore various attractions along the promenade.Things to do: Relaxing, food tourHow to Reach from Bangalore: To reach Marina Beach from Bangalore, you can take a train, bus, or a flight to Chennai, and from there, you can easily access the beach by local transportation or taxi. Chennai is well-connected to Bangalore by road, rail, and air. Distance from Bangalore: 351 km Read More 12. Dhanushkodi Beach 3.5 /5 Dhanushkodi Beach, situated at the southeastern tip of India on the Pamban Island, is a pristine and secluded shoreline that offers breathtaking views of the Bay of Bengal and the Indian Ocean merging. Visitors can enjoy the tranquil beauty of the beach and explore the remnants of a once-thriving town that was submerged in a cyclone.Things to do: Relaxing, walkingHow to Reach from Bangalore: The most convenient way to reach Dhanushkodi Beach from Bangalore is by a combination of road and train or by taking a flight to Madurai and then traveling by road to Dhanushkodi. It's approximately a 10-12 hour journey. Distance from Bangalore: 618 km Read More 13. Auroville Beach 4.3 /5 Auroville Beach, also known as the Auro Beach is located in Pondicherry. It is a part of the Auroville Ashram and is situated about 10 kilometres away. Auro Beach is one of the most popular beaches near Bangalore. This is a public beach and closes at around 6:30 in the evening. The tides on the beach are generally low thereby making it a good place to swim.Things to do: Swimming, relaxing, food tourHow to Reach from Bangalore: The journey by car typically takes around 6 to 7 hours. You can also opt for bus services or a train to reach Pondicherry, and from there, you can hire a taxi or use local transportation to reach Auroville Beach. Distance from Bangalore: 310 km Read More 14. Devbagh Beach, Karwar 4.1 /5 Perhaps one of the most famous beaches near Bangalore, Devbagh beach is a nature lover's paradise. This quiet seaside in Karwar may seem like the typical beach experience at first glance, yet it offers so much more. The river Karli meets the Arabian Sea at this spot, which together with the pristine beauty of surrounding mountains makes for a splendid sight.Things to do: Scuba diving, snorkelling, water sportsHow to Reach from Bangalore: To reach Devbagh Beach from Bangalore, you can travel by road. The journey takes around 9-10 hours, and you can enjoy a scenic drive through Karnataka's beautiful landscapes. Distance from Bangalore: 528 km Read More 15. Panambur Beach, Mangalore 4.3 /5 View 5+ photos Panambur Beach is located at a distance of 13 km from Mangalore to the south of Mangalore port. Every year it is visited by tonnes of visitors for it hosts several carnivals comprising of boat racing, kite flying and making sand sculptures. Despite a massive footfall, it is the cleanest beach one can ever come across. Things to do: Motorboat Rides, Banana Rides, Jet Skiing, Water-Scooter Rides, Parasailing, SurfingHow to Reach from Bangalore: Take a train to Mangalore Central Railway Station. From the railway station, you can hire a taxi or use local transport to reach the beach, which is approximately 10 kilometers from the city center. Distance from Bangalore: 356 km Read More 16. Anjuna Beach, Goa 4.4 /5 View 6+ photos Anjuna Beach, Goa, is a vibrant and iconic destination famous for its bohemian atmosphere and stunning coastline. Visitors can enjoy the laid-back beach vibes, water sports, and vibrant nightlife that define this coastal gem. Located near Panjim at a distance of 21 km, it is among the most popular beaches in North Goa. Things to do: Water sports, swimming, shoppingHow to Reach from Bangalore: The journey takes around 9-10 hours by road. You can also consider taking a train to the nearest railway station, Thivim, and then hiring a local taxi to reach the beach. Distance from Bangalore: 607 km Tours starting from ₹715 Read More 17. Majali beach, Karwar 3.4 /5 Majali Beach, situated in Karwar, is a pristine coastal haven renowned for its serene atmosphere and golden sands. It's an ideal destination for those seeking relaxation by the sea, with options for beachcombing and enjoying the tranquil ambiance.Things to do: Fishing, boating, kayakingHow to Reach from Bangalore: It's approximately a 10 to 12-hour drive via NH66. You can also consider traveling by train to Karwar Railway Station and then taking a local transport to the beach. Distance from Bangalore: 529 km Read More 18. Kodi Bengre Beach, Mangalore Kodi Bengre Beach, located near Mangalore, is a tranquil coastal paradise renowned for its serene shores and picturesque landscapes. Visitors can enjoy beachcombing, birdwatching, and serene walks along the sandy shores.Things to do: Relaxing, walkingHow to Reach from Bangalore: To reach Kodi Bengre Beach from Bangalore, you can take a train or bus to Mangalore, and from there, you can hire a local taxi or drive to the beach. The beach is approximately 14.9km from Mangalore. Read More 19. Gokarna Beach 4.3 /5 View 5+ photos Gokarna beach is several kilometres long and is situated at the edge of Gokarna which is a quaint pilgrim town in Karnataka. It has recently gained popularity as a go-to beach destination owing to its beautiful stretches of sand and pristine locations. Walking along the coastline here is unique as you will come across many cafes and shacks.Things to do: Surfing, jet ski, yoga, trekHow to Reach from Bangalore: To reach Gokarna from Bangalore, you can take a train, bus, or drive by car. The journey typically takes around 8 to 10 hours, depending on the mode of transportation chosen. Distance from Bangalore: 484 km Read More 20. Kozhikode Beach 4.5 /5 View 23+ photos Kozhikode Beach is also known as the Calicut Beach and is situated on the Malabar Coast. The beach road was named as 'Gandhi Road' after Mahatma Gandhi paid a visit to Calicut in 1934. The place has always been prominent for hosting public meetings. It has a long drive from Beypore in the south to Kappad in the north. Things to do: Swimming, boating, water sportsHow to Reach from Bangalore: Travelers can reach Kozhikode by road or by taking a train or flight to Kozhikode (Calicut) Airport or Kozhikode Railway Station. Distance from Bangalore: 352 km Read More 21. Maravanthe Beach 3.7 /5 View 8+ photos Maravanthe Beach, located on the coastal stretch of Karnataka, is a unique and picturesque destination where the Arabian Sea meets the Sauparnika River, creating a breathtaking shoreline. Visitors can enjoy the serene beauty of the beach, making it an ideal spot for relaxation and coastal exploration.Things to do: Swimming, Seafood tourHow to Reach from Bangalore: It's approximately an 8-9 hour drive via National Highway 66 (NH66). You can also consider train or bus options to reach the Udupi district and then continue to Maravanthe Beach by local transport. Distance from Bangalore: 422 km Read More 22. Baga Beach, Goa 4.5 /5 View 5+ photos One of the most popular beaches in North Goa, Baga Beach is located close to Calangute beach, around 30 Km North of Panaji. It is so named after the 'Baga creek' which flows into the Arabian Sea. Baga is the perfect destination for you if you wish to witness the excellent nightlife of Goa as signature places such as Britto's, Tito's, and Mambos have made their mark in the hearts of party-goers. Things to do: Water sports, swimming, shoppingHow to Reach from Bangalore: The most convenient way is to take a flight to Goa's Dabolim Airport, located approximately 40 kilometers from Baga Beach. Alternatively, you can opt for a train journey to Thivim Railway Station or a bus ride to the nearest bus terminal in Goa. From there, you can hire local transport to reach Baga Beach. Distance from Bangalore: 605 km Tours starting from ₹715 Read More 23. Lighthouse Beach, Kovalam 4.3 /5 Lighthouse Beach in Kovalam is a pristine sandy stretch along the Arabian Sea, known for its iconic red-and-white striped lighthouse. It's a popular destination for sunbathing and water sports, offering a beautiful view of the sea and the opportunity to witness breathtaking sunsets.Things to do: Water sports, yogaHow to Reach from Bangalore: The most convenient way to reach is by a combination of train and road or by air to Thiruvananthapuram, followed by a short drive to Kovalam. Distance from Bangalore: 724 km Read More 24. Elliot's Beach, Chennai 4.2 /5 Elliot's Beach, also known as "Besant Nagar Beach," is a popular coastal destination in Chennai, offering a tranquil escape with its sandy shores and gentle waves. Visitors can enjoy leisurely strolls along the promenade or indulge in delicious seafood at the nearby eateries.Things to do: Sunbathing, relaxing, walkingHow to Reach from Bangalore: Easily reached by road in 6-7 hours. The  most convenient way to reach is by taking a bus or driving via National Highway 44 (NH44). Distance from Bangalore: 351 km Read More Located in South India, there are multiple beaches near Bangalore to choose from each offering their own unique set of activities, shacks and cuisines.
